msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Remove ADOBE SYSTEMS license, if present, and insert Apache license - modules.  Will need another pass to convert files not handled by the scripts.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Separating string escaping of media queries for the source generation and direct-AST generation code paths, only the former requires the escaping.
QE notes: Please test @media queries with and without -keep.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Part 2 of CSS Media Query support. Now that Batik has been updated to support media query syntax for @media rules in Part 1, this change updates the Flex SDK compiler to process these new rules and generate conditional ActionScript that queries whether the media features match the runtime and thus the selectors should apply.

This change was complicated by the fact that the framework requires re-occuring selectors to be merged. The work around was to generate conditional checks inside the style protochain factory functions. Theoretically this means that the queries could be re-evaluated at runtime if needed too.

Part 3 of this change will be from the framework team to introduce an ActionScript API on style manager that will check if a media query applies. As a place holder for now the generated code assumes that API is on mx.styles.IStyleManager.acceptMediaQuery(query:String):Boolean. This is currently only generated when -keep is enabled.
One the final runtime ActionScript API is signed off, the direct-AST generation path will be updated to create an AST fragment to check the media query.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fix 3.0 compatiblity-version bug with generated styles.
Turn –isloate-styles off in 3.0 compatibility mode. This flag also turns on the hidden option –allow-duplicate-default-style-declarations which is what fixes the bug.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Put default style declarations into one class per application or module.

Generate all the default styles in one class instead of a class for each style. The name of the style class will be based on the application or module name. An application named “foo” will have a style class named “_foo_Style”. The idea is to allow applications to be compiled with different themes and get their owns styles. Currently this is not possible because a global style in both themes will have the same class name, _globalStyle. Whatever class the top-level application loads the sub-applications and modules will have to use the same class because of the flash player first-class-in-wins rule. Now each application and module will have their own style class.
Tests run: checkintests, all mustella tests.
